ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: To PUT things right
ygData.msgSnippet: ... But what are the right status codes? And under what conditions are servers allowed to return them? That s the rub. If the server returns 200 OK or 201

A. Pagaltzis wrote:

> However, the server *is* free to interpret PUT requests as it
> sees fit. A server that does useless things with a PUT request
> but returns the right status codes isn’t broken; it’s simply
> useless. There is no problem with this, though: usefulness is
> a human concept, not a formal one. In the long run, no one will
> continue using such a server; and that’s the end of its useless
> but compliant behaviour.

But what are the right status codes? And under what conditions are 
servers allowed to return them? That's the rub. If the server returns 
200 OK or 201 CREATED what may the client reasonably infer from that 
response about what the server has done?

--
